values.value: FedRAMP AC-2 (Account Management) requires strict access control management for federal information systems. All user accounts must be authorized, reviewed quarterly, and follow least privilege principles. Privileged access must be limited and monitored.
FedRAMP Moderate Baseline AC-2 - Account Management, AC-3 - Access Enforcement

1. Conduct quarterly access reviews for all user accounts. 2. Remove or disable accounts for users inactive 90+ days. 3. Limit privileged access (Modify All Data, View All Data) to less than 5% of users. 4. Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all users. 5. Document all access grants with business justification and approval. 6. Maintain access certification records for audit purposes.
